Kenneth Stanley wrote:
> 
> Petar, I agree that it would be interesting to introduce a kind of
> mutation that automatically bumps up the substrate density (i.e. #
> of nodes in the substrate). It would also be interesting to allow
> HyperNEAT to decide the locations of the nodes in the substrate on
> its own.

I think this is important.  Part of the draw to NEAT, for me, is  the 
low level of human configuration and design required.

Ken, I had another question related to varying node density on the 
substrate.  The CPNN may (likely) connect 'regions' heavily, and so as 
node density increases, so will these regional connections.  My question 
is, is there evidence of this in biology?  That is, of groups of neurons 
regionally strongly connected to other groups of neurons?  I realize 
it's probably mostly irrelevant, but I'm curious if it's something 
you've researched.

Thanks,
Steve
